 36008                                  ;============================================================================
 36009                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36010                                  ;============================================================================
 36011                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36012                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36013                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36014                                  
 36015                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36016                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36017                                  
 36018                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36019                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36020                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36021                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36022                                  ;
 36023                                  ;	IsEof
 36024                                  ;	UNPACK
 36025                                  ;	PACK
 36026                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36027                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36028                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36029                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36030                                  ;
 36031                                  ;	Revision history:
 36032                                  ;
 36033                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36034                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36035                                  ;
 36036                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36037                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36038                                  
 36039                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36040                                  
 36041                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36042                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36043                                  
 36044                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36046                                  ;
 36047                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36048                                  ;
 36049                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36050                                  ;
 36051                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36052                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36053                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36054                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36055                                  ;
 36056                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36057                                  
 36058                                  IsEOF:
 36059                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36060                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36061                                  	;;;
 36062 00005F0C E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36063 00005F0F 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36064                                  
 36065                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36066 00005F11 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36067 00005F18 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36068 00005F1A 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36069                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36070 00005F1D C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36071                                  
 36072                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36073                                  	;;;
 36074                                  
 36075                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36076 00005F1E 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36077 00005F24 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36078                                  
 36079                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36080                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36081                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36082                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36083                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36084                                  
 36085 00005F26 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36086 00005F2A 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36087                                  
 36088 00005F2C 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36089                                  IsEOF_other:
 36090 00005F30 C3                      	retn
 36091                                  EOF16:
 36092 00005F31 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36093 00005F34 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36094                                  
 36095                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36096                                  
 36097                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36098                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36099                                  ;
 36100                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36101                                  ;
 36102                                  ; Inputs:
 36103                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36104                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36105                                  ; Outputs:
 36106                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36107                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36108                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36109                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36110                                  ;
 36111                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36112                                  ;
 36113                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36114                                  
 36115                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36116                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36117                                  	;
 36118                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36119                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36120                                  
 36121                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36122                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36123                                  
 36124                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36125                                  UNPACK:
 36126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36127 00005F35 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36128 00005F37 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36129                                  
 36130                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36131                                  %if 0
 36132                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36133                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0

 36313                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36314                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36315                                  ;
 36316                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36317                                  ;
 36318                                  ; Inputs:
 36319                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36320                                  ;	DX = Data
 36321                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36322                                  ; Outputs:
 36323                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36324                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36325                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36326                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36327                                  ;
 36328                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36329                                  ;
 36330                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36331                                  
 36332                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36333                                  
 36334                                  	; INPUT:
 36335                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36336                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36337                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36338                                  
 36339                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36340                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36342                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start

 36344 00005FE6 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36345                                  
 36346                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36347                                  %if 0
 36348                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36349                                  	retn				; done
 36350                                  %else
 36351                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36352                                  	;;;
 36353 00005FE8 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36354 00005FEC 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36355                                  
 36356                                  	;push	ax
 36357                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 36358                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 36359                                  	;pop	ax
 36360 00005FEE FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 36361 00005FF2 8F06[350F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36362                                  
 36363 00005FF6 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36364 00005FFA C3                      	retn
 36365                                  	;;;
 36366                                  %endif

 36369                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36377 00006009 59                      	POP	CX

 36532                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36533                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36534                                  ;
 36535                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36536                                  ;
 36537                                  ; Inputs:
 36538                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36539                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36540                                  ; Function:
 36541                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36542                                  ; Outputs:
 36543                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36544                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36545                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36546                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36547                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36548                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36549                                  ;
 36550                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36551                                  
 36552                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36553                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36554                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36555                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36556                                  
 36557                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36558                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36559                                  
 36560                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36561                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36562 000060BC C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36563                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36564 000060C1 50                      	push	ax
 36565 000060C2 53                      	push	bx
 36566 000060C3 51                      	push	cx
 36567 000060C4 52                      	push	dx
 36568                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36569                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36570                                  
 36571                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36572                                  	;;;
 36573                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36574 000060C5 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36575 000060C7 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36576                                  	;
 36577 000060CB 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36578                                  	;
 36579 000060CC 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36580 000060CE E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36581 000060D1 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36582                                  	; FAT32
 36583 000060D3 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36584 000060D5 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36585 000060D7 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36586 000060D9 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36587 000060DB D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36588 000060DD D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36589                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36590 000060DF EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36591                                  mapcl1:
 36592                                  	;;;
 36593 000060E1 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36594                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36595                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36596                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36597                                  	;
 36598                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36599                                  	;;;
 36600 000060E7 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36601                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36602 000060E9 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36603 000060EB D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36604                                  mapcl2:
 36605 000060ED 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36606 000060EF 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36607 000060F3 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36608                                  	;;;
 36609                                  Map16:	
 36610                                  
 36611                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36612                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36613                                  %if 0
 36614                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36615                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36616                                  	
 36617                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36618                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36619                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36620                                  %endif
 36621                                  
 36622 000060F5 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36623                                  
 36624                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36625                                  ;
 36626                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36627                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36628                                  ;
 36629                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36630                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36631                                  ;
 36632                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36633                                  
 36634 000060F9 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36635 000060FD 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36636                                  
 36637                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36638                                  %if 0
 36639                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36640                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36641                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36642                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36643                                  	;shr	al,1
 36644                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36645                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36646                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36647                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36648                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36649                                  %else
 36650                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36651                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36652                                  	;;;
 36653 000060FF 50                      	push	ax
 36654 00006100 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36655 00006102 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36656 00006104 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36657 00006106 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36658 00006108 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36659 0000610A 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36660 0000610C 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36661 0000610E D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36662 00006110 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36663 00006112 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36664 00006114 5A                      	pop	dx
 36665 00006115 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36666                                  	;;;
 36667                                  %endif
 36668 00006119 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36669                                  
 36670                                  _DoDiv:
 36671                                  ;ENDIF
 36672                                  
 36673                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36674                                  %if 0
 36675                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36676                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36677                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36678                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36679                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36680                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36681                                  %else
 36682                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36683                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36684                                  	;;;
 36685 0000611B 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36686 0000611C 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36687 0000611D F7F1                    	div	cx

 36692                                  %endif

 36696                                  ;ENDIF

 36701                                  	;;;

 36703                                  	;;;
 36704                                  
 36705 00006129 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36706                                  
 36707                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36708                                  
 36709                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36710                                  	;;;
 36711 0000612A 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36712                                  	;;;

 36718

 36720                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36721 00006130 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36722                                  	;
 36723

 36725                                  	; 22/09/2023

 36727                                  	;

 36732                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36733                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36734 00006132 E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36735                                  
 36736                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36737 00006135 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*

 36753 00006144 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36754 00006146 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss
 36755 00006148 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]

 36757 0000614A 16                      	push	ss
 36758 0000614B 1F                      	pop	ds

 36773                                  	;;;

 36799                                  	;;;

 36801                                  	;;;
 36802                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 36803 0000617D 5A                      	pop	dx
 36804 0000617E 59                      	pop	cx
 36805 0000617F 5B                      	pop	bx
 36806                                  
 36807 00006180 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 36808

 36810                                  	;;;
 36811 00006182 E822FF                  	call	IsFAT32

 36813                                  	;;;
 36814

 36816 0000618D 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 36817 0000618F 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX

 36820                                  	;RESTORE <AX>

 36823

 36830                                  	;;;

 36832 00006199 5A                      	pop	dx
 36833 0000619A 59                      	pop	cx
 36834 0000619B 5B                      	pop	bx
 36835 0000619C 58                      	pop	ax
 36836                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 36837 0000619D C3                      	retn

 36843

 36846                                  
 36847                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36849                                  ;
 36850                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36851                                  ;
 36852                                  ; Inputs:
 36853                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36854                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36855                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36856                                  ; Function:
 36857                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36858                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36859                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36860                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36861                                  ; Outputs:
 36862                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36863                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36864                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36865                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36866                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36867                                  ;
 36868                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36869                                  
 36870                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36871 0000619E 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36872                                  
 36873                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36874                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36875                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36876                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36877 000061A2 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36878 000061A6 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36879 000061A9 E8CAA4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36880                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36881                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36882 000061AC E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36883                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36884                                  	;retn
 36885                                  
 36886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36887                                  ;
 36888                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36889                                  ;
 36890                                  ; Inputs:
 36891                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36892                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36893                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36894                                  ; Function:
 36895                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36896                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36897                                  ; Outputs:
 36898                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36899                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36900                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36901                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36902                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36903                                  ;
 36904                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36905                                  
 36906                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36907                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36908                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36909                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36910                                  
 36911                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36912                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36913                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36914                                  
 36915                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36916 000061AF 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36917 000061B0 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36918                                  
 36919                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36920 000061B1 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36921                                  
 36922                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36923                                  %if 0
 36924                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36925                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36926                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36927                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36928                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36929                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36930                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36931                                  %else
 36932                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36933                                  	;;;
 36934 000061B5 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36935                                  	;;;
 36936                                  %endif
 36937 000061B8 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36938 000061B9 07                      	POP	ES
 36939 000061BA 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36940 000061BC 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36941                                  
 36942                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36943                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36944                                  
 36945                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36946                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36947                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36948                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36949 000061BE B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36950                                  	
 36951 000061C1 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36952 000061C2 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36953 000061C6 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36954                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36955 000061C8 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36956                                  
 36957                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36958                                  
 36959                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36960                                  ;
 36961                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36962                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36963                                  
 36964 000061CC 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36965                                  frcd20: 
 36966                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36967                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36968 000061D1 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36969 000061D6 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36970                                  
 36971                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36972                                  	;push	es
 36973                                  	;push	di
 36974                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36975                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36976                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36977                                  	;pop	di
 36978                                  	;pop	es
 36979                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36980                                  
 36981                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36982 000061D8 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36983 000061DC 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36984 000061DE 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36985 000061E0 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36986 000061E4 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36987                                  
 36988                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36989                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh
 36990 000061E6 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 36991                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 36992                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 36993                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 36994                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 36995                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 36996                                  		; jz short frcd25
 36997                                  		;
 36998                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36999 000061EA 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 37000                                  
 37001                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37002                                  	;;;
 37003                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37004 000061EC 2685454B                	test	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],AX
 37005 000061F0 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 37006                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 37007                                  	;;;
 37008                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37009 000061F2 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37010                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37011                                  	;;;
 37012                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37013 000061F6 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 37014                                  	;;;
 37015                                  frcd25:	
 37016                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37017                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37018 000061FA 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37019 000061FD E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37020 000061FF 1F                      	POP	DS
 37021                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37022 00006200 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37023 00006204 F8                      	CLC
 37024 00006205 C3                      	retn
 37025                                  
 37026                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37027                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37028                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37029                                  ;;;
 37030                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37031                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37032 00006206 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37033 0000620B 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37034                                  	; FAT32
 37035                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37036 0000620D 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37037                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 37038 00006212 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37039 00006218 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37040                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37041                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 37042 0000621A 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37043                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37044                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37045 0000621F 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37046 00006225 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37047                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 37048 00006227 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37049                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37050 0000622C C3                      	retn
 37051                                  ;;;

 37068                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37069                                  FATERR:
 37070

 37503                                  	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]		;>32mb
 37504                                  	;mov	[di-09h],ax					;AC000;

 37506                                  					;>32mb Correct buffer info ;AC000;

 37508                                  	push	ss
 37509                                  	pop	ds
 37510                                  	XOR	AL,AL			;Media changed (Z), Carry clear
 37511                                  	retn
 37512                                  
 37513                                  FATERRJ: 
 37514                                  	JMP	FATERR
 37515                                  
 37516                                  %else
 37517                                  	; 04/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37518                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 37529

 37753                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37754                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 12/03/2018
 37755                                  ;
 37756                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37757                                  ;
 37758                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37759                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37760                                  ;
 37761                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37762                                  ;
 37763                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37764                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37765                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37766                                  ;; Inputs:
 37767                                  ;;      None
 37768                                  ;; Function:
 37769                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37770                                  ;; Outputs:
 37771                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37772                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37773                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37774                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37775                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37776                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37777                                  ;
 37778                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37779                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37780                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37781                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37782                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37783                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37784                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37785                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37786                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37787                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37788                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37789                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37790                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37791                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37792                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37793                                  ;       RETN
 37794                                  ;
 37795                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37796                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37797                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37798                                  ;
 37799                                  ;; Inputs:
 37800                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37801                                  ;; Function:
 37802                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37803                                  ;; Outputs:
 37804                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37805                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37806                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37807                                  ;
 37808                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37809                                  ;       ;retz
 37810                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37811                                  ;
 37812                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37813                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37814                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37815                                  ;
 37816                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37817                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37818                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37819                                  ;	
 37820                                  ;	push	ax
 37821                                  ;	or	al,1
 37822                                  ;	pop	ax
 37823                                  ;	retn	
 37824                                  ;
 37825                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37826                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37827                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37828                                  
 37829                                  ;============================================================================
 37830                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37831                                  ;============================================================================
 37832                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 37835                                  
 37836                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37837                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37838                                  
 37839                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37840                                  ;
 37841                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37842                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37843                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37844                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37845                                  ;	PointComp
 37846                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37847                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37848                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37849                                  ;	BufWrite
 37850                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37851                                  ;
 37852                                  ;	Revision history:
 37853                                  ;
 37854                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37855                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37856                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37857                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37858                                  
 37859                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37860                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37861                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37862                                  ; Inputs:
 37863                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37864                                  ; Function:
 37865                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37866                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37867                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37868                                  ; Outputs:
 37869                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37870                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37871                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37872                                  ; No other registers altered
 37873                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37874                                  
 37875                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37876                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37877                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37878                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37879                                  
 37880                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37881                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37882                                  
 37883                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37884 0000650D 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37885 00006512 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37886 00006519 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37887 0000651E C3                      	retn
 37888                                  
 37889                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37890                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37891                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37892                                  ; Inputs:
 37893                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37894                                  ; Function:
 37895                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37896                                  ; Outputs:
 37897                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37898                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37899                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37900                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37901                                  
 37902                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37903                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37904                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37905                                  ;	push	es
 37906                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37907                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37908                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37909                                  ;	push	es
 37910                                  ;	pop	ds
 37911                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37912                                  ;	pop	es
 37913                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37914                                  ;	retn	
 37915                                  	
 37916                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37917                                  SCANPLACE:
 37918 0000651F FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37919                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37920 00006521 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37921 00006524 5F                      	pop	di
 37922 00006525 C3                      	retn
 37923                                  
 37924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37925                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37926                                  ; Input:
 37927                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37928                                  ; Function:
 37929                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37930                                  ; NO registers altered
 37931                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37932                                  
 37933                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37934                                  
 37935                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37936                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37937                                  PLACEBUF:
 37938                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37939                                  
 37940                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37941 00006526 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37942 00006527 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37943                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37944                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37945                                  	
 37946 00006528 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37947                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37948 0000652A 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37949                                  	
 37950 0000652F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37951 00006531 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37952 00006533 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37953 00006535 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37954 00006537 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37955 0000653B EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37956                                  not_first:
 37957                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37958 0000653D 56                      	push	si
 37959                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37960 0000653E 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37961 00006541 8904                    	mov	[si],ax

 38115                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38116                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38117                                  ;
 38118                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38119                                  ; Inputs:
 38120                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38121                                  ; Function:
 38122                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38123                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38124                                  ;	   same segment
 38125                                  ;
 38126                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38127                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38128                                  ; No Registers altered
 38129                                  ;
 38130                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38131                                  
 38132                                  POINTCOMP:
 38133                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38134                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38135 00006563 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38136 00006565 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38137                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38138 00006567 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38139 00006568 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38140 00006569 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38141 0000656B 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38142 0000656D 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38143 0000656F 5A                      	POP	DX
 38144 00006570 59                      	POP	CX
 38145                                  _ret_label:
 38146 00006571 C3                      	retn

 38148                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38149                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38150                                  
 38151                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38152                                  
 38153                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38154                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38155                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38156                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38157                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38158                                  ; 
 38159                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38160                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38161                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38162                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38163                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38164                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38165                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38166                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38167                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38168                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38169                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38170                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38171                                  
 38172                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38173                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38174                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38175                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38176                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38177                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38178                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38179                                  ; 
 38180                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38181                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38182                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38183                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38184                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38185                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38186                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38187                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38188                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38189                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38190                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38191                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38192                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38193                                  
 38194                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38811                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 38812                                  ;
 38813                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 38814                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 38815                                  ;
 38816                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 38817                                  ;
 38818                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 38820                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38821

 38824                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 38825                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38826 0000673B B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 38827                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 38828 0000673D 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 38829 00006740 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear

 38832                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 38833 00006746 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38834 00006749 F8                      	CLC
 38835 0000674A 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT

 38838                                  	;;;

 38840 0000674E 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 38841                                  	;test	ss:drive_flags[bx],8 
 38842 00006750 36F687[1012]08          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],8 ; bit 3
 38843 00006756 75E2                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn
 38844                                  	;;;
 38845                                  
 38846                                  DOBUFFER:

 38848 00006758 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 38849 0000675C 74DC                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 38850 0000675E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 38851                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 38852 0000675F FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38853 00006762 E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE

 38858                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 38859 0000676B 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 38860                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 38861 0000676E 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 38862                                  checkflush_retn:

 38865                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38866                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38867                                  ;
 38868                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38869                                  ;
 38870                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38871                                  ;
 38872                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 38873                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38874                                  ;
 38875                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38876                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 38877                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38878                                  
 38879                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38880                                  	; DOSCODE:9AA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38881                                  
 38882                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38883                                  	; DOSCODE:9A45h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38884                                  
 38885                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38886                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0ACB1h
 38887                                  
 38888                                  BUFWRITE:
 38889                                  	; 10/09/2018
 38890                                  	; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38891                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E94h

 39174                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39175                                  ;============================================================================
 39176                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39177                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39178                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39179                                  
 39180                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39181                                  
 39182                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39183                                  
 39184                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39185                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39186                                  
 39187                                  ; =========================================================================
 39188                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39189                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39190                                  ;
 39191                                  ;	$WAIT
 39192                                  ;	$EXEC
 39193                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39194                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39195                                  ;	$EXIT
 39196                                  ;	$ABORT
 39197                                  ;	abort_inner
 39198                                  ;
 39199                                  ;	Modification history:
 39200                                  ;
 39201                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39202                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39203                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39204                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39205                                  ;
 39206                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39207                                  ;
 39208                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39209                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39210                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39211                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39212                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39213                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39214                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39215                                  ;
 39216                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39217                                  ;
 39218                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39219                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39220                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39221                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39222                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39223                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39224                                  ;
 39225                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39226                                  ;
 39227                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39228                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39229                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39230                                  ;
 39231                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39232                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39233                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39234                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39235                                  ;
 39236                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39237                                  ;
 39238                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39239                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39240                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39241                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39242                                  ;
 39243                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39244                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39245                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39246                                  ;
 39247                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39248                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39249                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39250                                  ;
 39251                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39252                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39253                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39254                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39255                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39256                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39257                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39258                                  ;
 39259                                  ; =========================================================================
 39260                                  
 39261                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39262                                  
 39263                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39264                                  ; =========================================================================
 39265                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39266                                  ;
 39267                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39268                                  ;
 39269                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39270                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39271                                  ;
 39272                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39273                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39274                                  ;	USES	all
 39275                                  ; =========================================================================
 39276                                  
 39277                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39278                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39279                                  
 39280                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39281                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39282                                  
 39283                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39284                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39285                                  
 39286                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39287                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39288                                  
 39289                                  _$WAIT:
 39290                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39291                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39292                                  
 39293 00006832 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39294 00006834 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39295 00006839 E9439E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39297                                  ; =========================================================================
 39298                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39299                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39300                                  ;
 39301                                  ;
 39302                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39303                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39304                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39305                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39306                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39307                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39308                                  ;
 39309                                  ;	AL  Function
 39310                                  ;	--  --------
 39311                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39312                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39313                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39314                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39315                                  ;
 39316                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39317                                  ;
 39318                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39319                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39320                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39321                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39322                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39323                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39324                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39325                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39326                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39327                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39328                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39329                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39330                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39331                                  ;
 39332                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39333                                  ;
 39334                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39335                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39336                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39337                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39338                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39339                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39340                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39341                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39342                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39343                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39344                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39345                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39346                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39347                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39348                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39349                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39350                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39351                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39352                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39353                                  ;
 39354                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39355                                  ;
 39356                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39357                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39358                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39359                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39360                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39361                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39362                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39363                                  ;
 39364                                  ; Returns:
 39365                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39366                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39367                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39368                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39369                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39370                                  ; =========================================================================
 39371                                  ;
 39372                                  ;   Revision history:
 39373                                  ;
 39374                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39375                                  ;
 39376                                  ; =========================================================================
 39377                                  
 39378                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39379                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39380                                  
 39381                                  ; =========================================================================
 39382                                  
 39383                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 39384                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39385                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39386                                  ;%out
 39387                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39388                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39389                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39390                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39391                                  ;ENDIF

 39400                                  	; DOSCODE:9B5Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39401
