 39412                                  _$EXEC:
 39413                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 39415                                  
 39416                                  EXEC001S:
 39417                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 39418                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 39419                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 39420                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 39421                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 39422                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 39423                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 39424                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 39425                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 39426                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 39427                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 39428                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 39429                                  	;
 39430                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 39431                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 39432                                  
 39433                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 39434                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 39435                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 39436                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]
 39437                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 39438                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 39439                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 39440                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 39441                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 39442                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 39443                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 39444                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 39445                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 39446                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 39447                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 39448                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 39449                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 39450                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]
 39451                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 39452                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39453                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 39454                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 39455                                  	
 39456                                  	; ==================================================================
 39457                                  	; validate function
 39458                                  	; ==================================================================
 39459                                  		      	
 39460                                  	; M068 - Start
 39461                                  	;
 39462                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39463                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39464                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39465                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39466                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39467                                  
 39468                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39469 0000683C 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39470                                  
 39471                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39472                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39473                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39474                                  
 39475 00006842 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39476                                  	;jne	short @f
 39477 00006844 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39478                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39479 00006846 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39480 00006847 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39481 0000684A 51                      	push	cx
 39482                                  ;@@:
 39483                                  Exec_@f:
 39484                                  	; M068 - End
 39485                                  	
 39486                                  	;Enter
 39487                                  
 39488 0000684B 55                      	push	bp
 39489 0000684C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39490                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39491                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39492                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 39493                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39494                                  	; 20/05/2019
 39495 0000684E 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0
 39496                                  
 39497                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39498 00006851 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39499                                  					; M030
 39500 00006853 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39501                                  
 39502                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39503                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39504                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39505                                  
 39506                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 39507                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1

 39509                                  	; 01/07/2024
 39510 00006855 E876AA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk

 39513 00006858 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function

 39543 00006878 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL

 39557                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 39560                                  
 39561                                  	;xor	AL,AL			; open for reading

 39563                                  	;;;
 39564 00006895 B0A0                    	mov	al,0A0h			; Access mode bits: (0 to 2)
 39565                                  					; 000  read access

 41065                                  
 41066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41067                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41068                                  ;
 41069                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41070                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41071                                  ;
 41072                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41073                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41074                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41075                                  ;
 41076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41077                                  
 41078                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41079                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41080                                  
 41081                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41082                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41083                                  
 41084                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41085                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41086                                  
 41087                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41088 00006E48 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41089                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41090 00006E49 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41091 00006E4F 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41092 00006E54 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41093 00006E57 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41094                                  
 41095 00006E59 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41096                                  
 41097                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41098 00006E5C 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41099 00006E5E 53                      	push	BX
 41100 00006E5F 06                      	push	ES
 41101 00006E60 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41102 00006E63 1F                      	pop	DS
 41103 00006E64 5B                      	pop	BX
 41104 00006E65 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41105                                  
 41106 00006E67 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41107 00006E69 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41108                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41109 00006E6B A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41110                                  
 41111                                  Keep_Done:
 41112 00006E6E 58                      	pop	AX
 41113 00006E6F EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41114                                  
 41115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41116                                  ;

 41118

 41148                                  _$EXIT:
 41149                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41150                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h
 41151 00006E80 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH
 41152 00006E82 368626[4D03]            	xchg	AH,[SS:DidCTRLC]
 41153 00006E87 08E4                    	or	AH,AH
 41154                                  	;mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41155 00006E89 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_TERMINATE
 41156 00006E8F 7406                    	jz	short exit_inner
 41157                                  	;mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],1
 41158 00006E91 36C606[7C05]01          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_CTRL_C
 41159

 41161                                  exit_inner:
 41162 00006E97 E8F195                  	call	Get_User_Stack		;PBUGBUG
 41163                                  
 41164 00006E9A 36FF36[3003]            	push	word [ss:CurrentPDB]
 41165                                  	;pop	word [si+14h]
 41166 00006E9F 8F4414                  	pop	word [SI+user_env.user_CS] ;PBUGBUG
 41167 00006EA2 EB08                    	jmp	short abort_inner
 41168                                  
 41169                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41170                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41171                                  ; Inputs:
 41172                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41173                                  ; Function:
 41174                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41175                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41176                                  ; Returns:
 41177                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41179                                  
 41180                                  _$ABORT:
 41181 00006EA4 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41182                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41183                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41184 00006EA6 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41185                                  
 41186                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41187                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41188                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41189                                  
 41190                                  abort_inner:
 41191 00006EAC 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41192 00006EB1 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41193 00006EB5 E8D395                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41194                                  
 41195                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41196 00006EB8 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41197 00006EBB 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41198 00006EBD 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41199                                  	;mov	si,10
 41200 00006EBF BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41201                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41202 00006EC2 BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41203 00006EC5 A5                      	movsw
 41204 00006EC6 A5                      	movsw
 41205 00006EC7 A5                      	movsw
 41206 00006EC8 A5                      	movsw
 41207 00006EC9 A5                      	movsw
 41208 00006ECA A5                      	movsw
 41209 00006ECB E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment
 41210

 41405                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41406                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41407                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41408                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41409                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41410                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41411                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41412                                  
 41413                                  arena_next:
 41414 00006F08 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41415 00006F0A 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41416 00006F0E 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41417                                  
 41418                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41419                                  ;
 41420                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41421                                  ;       RETN
 41422                                  
 41423                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41425                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41426                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41427                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41428                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41429                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41430                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41431                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41432                                  
 41433                                  check_signature:        
 41434                                  
 41435 00006F0F 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41436                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41437 00006F11 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41438                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41439 00006F15 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41440                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41441 00006F17 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41442                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41443 00006F1B 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41444 00006F1D F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41445                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41446                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41447                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41448                                  check_signature_ok:
 41449                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41450 00006F1E C3                      	RETN
 41451                                  
 41452                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41453                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41454                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41455                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41456                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41457                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41458                                  ;
 41459                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41460                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41461                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41462                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41463                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41464                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41465                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41466                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41467                                          
 41468                                  Coalesce:
 41469                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41470 00006F1F 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41471                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41472                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41473 00006F22 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41474 00006F24 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41475                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41476 00006F27 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41477                                  
 41478                                  coalesce_check:
 41479                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41480 00006F29 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41481                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41482 00006F2E 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41483                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41484 00006F30 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41485 00006F35 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41486                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41487 00006F36 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41488 00006F3A 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41489 00006F3D 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41490 00006F3F EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 41492                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41493                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41494                                  
 41495                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41496                                  
 41497                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41499                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41500                                  ;
 41501                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41502                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41503                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41504                                  ;
 41505                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41506                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41507                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41508                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41509                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41510                                  ;
 41511                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41512                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41513                                  ;
 41514                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41515                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41516                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41517                                  ;           INT     21h
 41518                                  ;
 41519                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41520                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41521                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41522                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41523                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41524                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41525                                  ;
 41526                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41527                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41528                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41529                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41530                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41531                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41532                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41533                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41534                                  ;	USES	All
 41535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41536                                  
 41537                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41539                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41540                                  ;
 41541                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41542                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41543                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41544                                  ;           INT     21h
 41545                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41546                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41547                                  ;
 41548                                  ;   Description:
 41549                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41550                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41551                                  ;
 41552                                  ;   Error return:
 41553                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41554                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41556                                  
 41557                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41558                                  
 41559                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 41895                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41896                                  
 41897                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41899                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41900                                  ;
 41901                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41902                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41903                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41904                                  ;
 41905                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41906                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41907                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41908                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41909                                  ;
 41910                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41911                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41912                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41913                                  ;		code.
 41914                                  ;
 41915                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41916                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41917                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41918                                  ;
 41919                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41920                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41921                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41922                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41923                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41924                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41925                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41926                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41927                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41928                                  
 41929                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41930                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41931                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41932                                  ;
 41933                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41934                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41935                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41936                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41937                                  ;           INT     21h
 41938                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41939                                  ;         size possible
 41940                                  ;   Error return:
 41941                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41942                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41943                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41944                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41945                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41946                                  
 41947                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41948                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41949                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41950 00007092 E803A8                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41951                                  
 41952 00007095 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41953 00007098 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41954 0000709A 48                              DEC     AX
 41955 0000709B E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41956 0000709E 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41957                                  
 41958                                  setblock_bad:
 41959 000070A0 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed

 42042                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42043                                  
 42044                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42046                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42047                                  ;
 42048                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42049                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42050                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42051                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42052                                  ;           INT     21h
 42053                                  ;
 42054                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42055                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42056                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42057                                  ;
 42058                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42059                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42060                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42061                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42062                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42063                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42064                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42065                                  ;
 42066                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42067                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42068                                  ;
 42069                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42070                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42071                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42072                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42073                                  ;
 42074                                  ;
 42075                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42076                                  ;
 42077                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42078                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42079                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42080                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42081                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42082                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42083                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42084                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42085                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42086                                  ;
 42087                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42088                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42089                                  ;
 42090                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42091                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42092                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42093                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42094                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42095                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42096                                  
 42097                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42098                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42099                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42100                                  ;
 42101                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42102                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42103                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42104                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42105                                  ;           INT     21h
 42106                                  ;
 42107                                  ;   Error return:
 42108                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42110

 42330                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42331                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42332                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42333                                  ;
 42334                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42335                                  ;
 42336                                  ;
 42337                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42338                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42339                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42340                                  ;		   else
 42341                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42342                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42343                                  ;
 42344                                  ;		   CY if error
 42345                                  ;
 42346                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42347                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42348                                  
 42349                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42350                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42351                                  
 42352                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42353                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42354                                  
 42355                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42356                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42357                                  
 42358                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42359                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42360                                  
 42361                                  GetLastArena:
 42362 0000715B 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42363                                  
 42364 0000715C 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42365 00007160 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42366 00007162 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42367                                  
 42368 00007164 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42369                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42370 00007168 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42371                                  
 42372                                  GLA_next:
 42373 0000716A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42374 0000716C E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42375                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42376                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42377                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42378 0000716F 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42379                                  
 42380                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42381                                  %if 0
 42382                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42383                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42384                                  					;    umb_head
 42385                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42386                                  %else
 42387                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42388                                  	;;;
 42389 00007171 E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42390 00007174 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42391                                  	;;;
 42392                                  %endif
 42393 00007176 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42394                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42395 0000717A EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42396                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42397 0000717C 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42398                                  GLA_@f:
 42399 0000717E 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42400                                  
 42401                                  GLA_done:
 42402                                  
 42403                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42404                                  %if 0
 42405                                  					; M061 - Start
 42406                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42407                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42408                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42409                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42410                                  %else
 42411                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42412                                  	;;;
 42413 00007180 E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42414 00007183 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42415                                  	;;;
 42416                                  %endif
 42417 00007185 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42418 00007187 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42419                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42420 0000718A 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42421 0000718C 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42422 0000718E 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42423                                  					; M061 - End
 42424                                  GLA_ret:
 42425                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42426                                  	;clc
 42427                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42428                                  	;clc
 42429 00007190 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42430 00007191 C3                      	retn				; M061
 42431                                  
 42432                                  GLA_err:
 42433 00007192 F9                      	stc				; M061
 42434                                  GLA_err2:
 42435 00007193 58                      	pop	ax
 42436                                  
 42437                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42438                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42439                                  	;;;
 42440 00007194 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42441 00007195 E849A1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42442 00007198 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42443                                  	;;;
 42444                                  
 42445                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42446                                  	;retn

 42515                                  ;
 42516                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42517                                  ;
 42518                                  ; Inputs:
 42519                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42520                                  ; Function:
 42521                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42522                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42523                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42524                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42525                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42526                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42527                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42528                                  ;			CX User Index
 42529                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42530                                  ;			BX = UID
 42531                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42532                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42533                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42534                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42535                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42536                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42537                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42538                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42539                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42540                                  ;
 42541                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42542                                  
 42543                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42544                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42545                                  
 42546                                  _$ServerCall:

 42734

 42736                                  ; ES:DI point to stack

 42746 00007268 A5                      	MOVSW				; ES

 42749                                  	;MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.AX]
 42750                                  	;mov	bx,[si+2]

 42767 00007282 368C1E[EC05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVEDS],DS

 42770 00007292 E9F490                  	jmp	REDISP

 42867                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42868                                  
 42869                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42870                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42871                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42872                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42873                                  ;
 42874                                  ;	NOTE:
 42875                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42876                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42877                                  ;
 42878                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42879                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42880                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42881                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42882                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42883                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42884                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42885                                  
 42886                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42887                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42888                                  
 42889                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42890                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42891                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42892 000072E9 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42893                                  	
 42894                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42895 000072EE 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42896                                  
 42897                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42898 000072F3 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42899 000072F8 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42900                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42901                                  	;mov	al,6
 42902 000072FA B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42903                                  ReturnCarry:
 42904 000072FC F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42905 000072FD C3                      	retn				; go back
 42906                                  pjfn10: 
 42907                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42908 000072FE 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42909 00007303 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42910                                  	;clc
 42911                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42912 00007305 C3                      	retn
 42913                                  
 42914                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42916                                  ;
 42917                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42918                                  ;
 42919                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42920                                  ;
 42921                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42922                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42923                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42924                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42925                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42926                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42927                                  ; NOTE:
 42928                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42929                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42930                                  ;
 42931                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42932                                  
 42933                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42934                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42935                                  
 42936                                  SFFromHandle:
 42937 00007306 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42938                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42939 00007309 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42940 0000730B 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42941                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42942                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42943                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42944                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42945                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42946                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42947 0000730F 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42948                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42949                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42950                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42951                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42952                                  GetSF:
 42953 00007311 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42954 00007312 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42955 00007315 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42956 00007317 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42957 0000731A 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42958 0000731B C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42959                                  
 42960                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42961                                  
 42962                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42963                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42964                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42965                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42966                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42967                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42968                                  ;
 42969                                  ;   NOTE:
 42970                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42971                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42972                                  ;
 42973                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42974                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42975                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42976                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42977                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42978                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42979                                  
 42980                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42981                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42982                                  
 42983                                  SFFromSFN:
 42984                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42985                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42986 0000731C 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42987                                  
 42988                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42989 00007321 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42990                                  sfsfn5:	
 42991                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42992 00007326 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42993 0000732A 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42994                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42995 0000732C 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42996 00007330 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42997                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42998 00007333 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42999 00007336 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43000 00007338 F9                      	STC
 43001 00007339 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43002                                  sfsfn7:
 43003 0000733A 50                      	push	ax
 43004                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43005                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43006                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43007                                  	
 43008                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43009 0000733B B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43010                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43011                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43012                                  	
 43013 0000733D F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43014 0000733F 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43015 00007341 58                      	pop	ax
 43016                                  	;add	di,6
 43017 00007342 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43018 00007345 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43019                                  
 43020                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43021                                  
 43022                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43023                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43024                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43025                                  ;
 43026                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43027                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43028                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43029                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43030                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43031                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43032                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43034                                  
 43035                                  JFNFree:
 43036 00007346 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43037                                  jfnf1:	
 43038 00007348 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43039 0000734B 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43040 0000734D 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43041 00007351 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43042 00007353 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43043 00007354 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43044                                  
 43045                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43046                                  jfnf5:	
 43047                                  	;mov	al,4
 43048 00007356 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43049                                  jfnfx:	
 43050 00007358 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43051                                  
 43052                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43053                                  
 43054                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43056                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43057                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43058                                  ;
 43059                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43060                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43061                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43062                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43063                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43064                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43065                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43066                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43067                                  ;
 43068                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43069                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43070                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43071                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43072                                  ;
 43073                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43074                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43075                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43076                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43077                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43078                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43079                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43080                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43082                                  
 43083                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43084                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43085                                  
 43086                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43087                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43088                                  
 43089                                  SFNFree:
 43090                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43091                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43092                                  	;
 43093                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43094 00007359 50                      	push	ax
 43095 0000735A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43096                                  sfnf5:	
 43097 0000735C 53                      	push	bx
 43098 0000735D E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43099 00007360 5B                      	pop	bx
 43100 00007361 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43101 00007363 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43102                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43103 00007367 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43104                                  	
 43105                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43106 00007369 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43107                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43108 0000736D 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43109                                  sfnf7:	
 43110 0000736F 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43111 00007370 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43112                                  
 43113                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43114                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43115                                  ;
 43116                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43117                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43118                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43119                                  
 43120                                  sfnf10:	
 43121 00007372 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43122                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43123 00007376 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43124 0000737A 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43125 0000737C 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43126                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43127 00007380 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43128 00007384 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43129                                  
 43130                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43131                                  ;
 43132                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43133                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43134                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43135                                  
 43136                                  sfnf20:
 43137                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43138                                  
 43139                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43140 00007386 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43141                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43142                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43143                                  
 43144 0000738B 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43145                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43146 0000738F 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43147 00007393 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43148                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43149 00007397 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43150                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43151                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43152                                  	;pop	ax
 43153                                  	;;clc
 43154                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43155                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43156 0000739B 58                      	pop	ax
 43157                                  	;clc
 43158 0000739C C3                      	retn
 43159                                  
 43160                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43161                                  ;
 43162                                  ;	'C' set
 43163                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43164                                  
 43165                                  sfnf95: 
 43166 0000739D 58                      	pop	ax
 43167                                  
 43168                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43169                                  %if 0
 43170                                  	;mov	al,4
 43171                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43172                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43173                                  %else
 43174                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43175                                  	;;;
 43176 0000739E EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43177                                  	;;;
 43178                                  %endif
 43179

 43186                                  
 43187                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43188                                  
 43189                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43191                                  ;
 43192                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43193                                  ;
 43194                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43195                                  ;		path
 43196                                  ;
 43197                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43198                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43199                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43200                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43201                                  ;
 43202                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle

 43217                                  _$CLOSE:
 43218                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43219

 43225 000073AB 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43226                                  
 43227                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43228                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43229                                  ;
 43230                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43231                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43232                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.

 43244                                  
 43245                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43246                                  ; -1.
 43247

 43250 000073C2 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN

 43253                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!

 44320                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44322                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44323                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44324                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44325                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44326                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44327                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44328                                  ;
 44329                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44330                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44331                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44332                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44333                                  ;	USES	none
 44334                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44335                                  
 44336                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44337                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44338                                  CheckOwner:
 44339                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44340                                  
 44341 00007699 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44342 0000769C 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44343                                  
 44344 0000769E 50                      	push	ax
 44345                                  
 44346                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44347

 44349                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 44355

 44384                                  
 44385                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44386                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44387                                  
 44388                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44389                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44390                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44391                                  
 44392                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44393                                  ;
 44394                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44395                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44396                                  ;	InitCDS
 44397                                  ;	$UserOper
 44398                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44399                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44400                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44401                                  ;
 44402                                  ;   Revision history:
 44403                                  ;
 44404                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44405                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44406                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44407                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44408                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44409                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44410                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44411                                  ;
 44412                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44413                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44414                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44415                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44416                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44417                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44418                                  ;
 44419                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44420                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44421                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44422                                  ;
 44423                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44424                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44425                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44426                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44427                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44428                                  ;
 44429                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44430                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44431                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44432                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44433                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44434                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44435                                  ;
 44436                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44437                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44438                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44439                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44440                                  ;   number.
 44441                                  ;
 44442                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44443                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44444                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44445                                  ;   TransPath.
 44446                                  ;
 44447                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44448                                  
 44449                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44450                                  
 44451                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44452                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44453                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44454                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44455                                  ;					; current drive)
 44456                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44457                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44458                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44459                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44460                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44461                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44462                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44463                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44464                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
