 44466                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44467                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44468                                  ; Inputs:
 44469                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44470                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44471                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44472                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44473                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44474                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44475                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44476                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44477                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44478                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44479                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44480                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44481                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44482                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44483                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44484                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44485                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44486                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44487                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44488                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44489                                  ; Function:
 44490                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44491                                  ; Returns:
 44492                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44493                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44494

 44566                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44567                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44568                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44569                                  ;
 44570                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44571                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44572                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44573                                  ;		'C' clear
 44574                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44575                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 44576                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44577                                  
 44578                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44579                                  FIND_DPB:
 44580 000076F3 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 44581                                  fdpb5:	
 44582 000076F8 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1
 44583 000076FB 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 44584 000076FD 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]
 44585                                  	;CMP	AL,[SI+DPB.DRIVE]
 44586 000076FF 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 44587                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44588                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44589 00007701 C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]

 44666                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44668                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44669                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44670                                  ;
 44671                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44672                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44673                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44674                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44675                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44676                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44677                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44678                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44679                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44680                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44681                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word

 44683

 44978                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44979                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44980                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44981                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44982                                  ;
 44983                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44984                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44985                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44986                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44987                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44988                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44989                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44991                                  
 44992                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44993                                  TransFCB:
 44994                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44995                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44996                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44997                                  	;ENTER
 44998 0000782F 55                      	push	bp
 44999 00007830 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45000                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45001 00007832 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45002 00007835 16                      	push	ss
 45003 00007836 07                      	pop	es
 45004 00007837 06                      	push	es
 45005 00007838 57                      	push	di
 45006                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45007                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45008 00007839 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45009 0000783C 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45010 00007842 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45011 00007848 E8B5A9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45012                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45013 0000784B 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45014 0000784D 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45015 00007850 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45016 00007854 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45017                                  GetDrive:
 45018 0000785A AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45019 0000785B E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45020 0000785E 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45021 00007860 E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45022                                  
 45023                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45024                                  
 45025                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45026 00007863 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45027 00007866 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45028                                  FCBScan:
 45029 00007867 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45030                                  	
 45031                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45032                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45033                                  	;es	xlat
 45034                                  
 45035                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45036 00007868 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45037                                  
 45038                                  	;test	al,8	
 45039 0000786B A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45040 0000786D 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45041                                  NextCh:

 45043 00007871 5E                      	pop	si
 45044 00007872 89FB                    	mov	bx,di

 45046 00007877 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination

 45049 0000787A 1F                      	pop	ds

 45069                                  
 45070                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45071                                  
 45072                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45074                                  ;
 45075                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45076                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45077                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45078                                  ;       exactly.
 45079                                  ;
 45080                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45081                                  ;       matches splice.
 45082                                  ;
 45083                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45084                                  ;
 45085                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45086                                  ;
 45087                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45088                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45089                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45090                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45091                                  ;
 45092                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45093                                  ;
 45094                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45095                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45096                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45097                                  ;
 45098                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45099                                  ;
 45100                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45101                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45102                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45103                                  ;           splice
 45104                                  ;           fatRead
 45105                                  ;           return
 45106                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45107                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45108                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45109                                  ;           return
 45110                                  ;       if device then
 45111                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45112                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45113                                  ;           return
 45114                                  ;       if file then
 45115                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45116                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45117                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45118                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45119                                  ;           splice
 45120                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45121                                  ;           if local then
 45122                                  ;               fatread
 45123                                  ;           return
 45124                                  ;
 45125                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45126                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45127                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45128                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45129                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45130                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45131                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45132                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45133                                  ;
 45134                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45135                                  
 45136                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45137                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45138                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45139                                  
 45140                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45141                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45142                                  
 45143                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45144                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45145                                  
 45146                                  TransPath:
 45147 00007891 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45148 00007893 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45149                                  TransPathSet:
 45150 00007895 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45151                                  SetSplice:
 45152 00007897 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override

 45154                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45155 0000789D 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45156 000078A1 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45157 000078A7 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45158 000078AC 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45159 000078B3 16                      	push	ss
 45160 000078B4 07                      	pop	es
 45161                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45162 000078B5 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45163                                  ;
 45164                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45165                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45166                                  ;
 45167                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45168                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45169                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45170                                  	;;;
 45171 000078B9 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45172 000078BF 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45173                                  	;;;
 45174                                  ;
 45175                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45176                                  ;
 45177 000078C1 E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45178 000078C4 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45179 000078C7 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45180 000078C9 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45181 000078CC 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45182 000078CF E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45183 000078D2 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45184                                  ;
 45185                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45186                                  ;
 45187 000078D4 16                      	push	ss
 45188 000078D5 1F                      	pop	ds
 45189 000078D6 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45190 000078DA F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45191 000078DF 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45192 000078E1 E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45193                                  NoServerSplice:
 45194 000078E4 16                      	push	ss
 45195 000078E5 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45196 000078E6 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45197 000078EA E8AB9F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45198 000078ED E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45199 000078F0 E8D29F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45200                                  NoPath:
 45201                                  	;mov	al,3
 45202 000078F3 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45203 000078F5 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45204                                  
 45205                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45206                                  ; the name if so.
 45207                                  
 45208                                  CheckUNC:
 45209 000078F6 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45210                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45211 000078FD B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45212 00007900 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45213                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45214                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45215                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45216 00007902 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45217                                  
 45218                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45219                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45220                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45221                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45222                                  
 45223                                  NO_CHECK:
 45224 00007904 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45225 00007907 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45226 00007908 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45227 0000790A E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45228 0000790D 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45229 0000790F E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45230 00007912 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45231 00007914 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45232 00007916 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45233                                  
 45234                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45235                                  ; local machine root path
 45236                                  
 45237 00007918 58                      	POP     AX
 45238 00007919 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45239                                  UNCCpy:
 45240 0000791A AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45241 0000791B E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45242 0000791E 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45243 00007920 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45244 00007922 E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45245 00007925 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45246 00007927 AA                      	STOSB
 45247 00007928 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45248 0000792A E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45249                                  UNCDone:
 45250 0000792D 16                      	push	ss
 45251 0000792E 1F                      	pop	ds
 45252 0000792F C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45253                                  UNCTerm:
 45254 00007930 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45255 00007931 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45256                                  
 45257                                  CheckDevice:
 45258                                  
 45259                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45260                                  
 45261 00007933 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45262 00007934 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45263 00007937 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45264                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45265 00007939 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45266 0000793B F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45267 0000793C C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45268                                  CheckPath:
 45269 0000793D 50                      	push	ax
 45270 0000793E 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45271                                  
 45272                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45273                                  %if 0
 45274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45275                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45276                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45277                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45278                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45279                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45280                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45281                                  ;;;
 45282                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45283                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45284                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45285                                  ;;;
 45286                                  ;;;More info:
 45287                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45288                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45289                                  ;;;
 45290                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45291                                  start5Dhack:
 45292                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45293                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45294                                  
 45295                                  %endif
 45296                                  
 45297                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45298                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45299                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45300                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45301                                  %if 0
 45302                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45303                                  %else
 45304                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45305                                  
 45306                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45307                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45308 0000793F E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45309                                  %endif
 45310 00007942 5D                      	pop	bp
 45311 00007943 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45312 00007944 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45313                                  
 45314                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45315                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45316                                  ; call.
 45317                                  
 45318 00007946 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45319 0000794C E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45320 0000794F 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45321                                  
 45322                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45323                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45324                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45325                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45326                                  ; a device.
 45327                                  
 45328 00007955 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45329 00007958 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45330 0000795A AA                      	STOSB
 45331 0000795B E8449E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45332                                  
 45333 0000795E F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45334 0000795F 16                      	push	ss
 45335 00007960 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45336                                  DoFile_retn:
 45337 00007961 C3                      	retn
 45338                                  
 45339                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45340                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45341                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45342                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45343                                  ;%if 1
 45344                                  
 45345                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45346                                  %if 0
 45347                                  
 45348                                  no5Dshere:
 45349                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45350                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45351                                  %endif
 45352                                  
 45353                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45354                                  
 45355                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45356                                  
 45357                                  DoFile:
 45358                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45359                                  
 45360 00007962 E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45361                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45362 00007965 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45363 00007967 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45364                                  
 45365                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45366                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45367                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45368                                  
 45369                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45370 00007969 1E                      	push	ds
 45371 0000796A 56                      	push	si
 45372 0000796B 06                      	push	es
 45373 0000796C 57                      	push	di
 45374 0000796D E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45375                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45376 00007970 5F                      	pop	di
 45377 00007971 07                      	pop	es
 45378 00007972 5E                      	pop	si
 45379 00007973 1F                      	pop	ds
 45380                                  	;mov	al,3
 45381 00007974 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45382                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45383 00007976 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45384                                  
 45385                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45386                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45387                                  
 45388 00007978 1E                      	push	ds
 45389 00007979 56                      	push	si
 45390 0000797A 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45391 0000797F 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45392                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45393 00007981 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45394                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45395 00007984 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45396                                  					;AN000;
 45397 00007988 E8269E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45398 0000798B 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45399                                  
 45400                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45401                                  
 45402 0000798C B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45403 0000798E 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45404 00007992 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45405 00007994 AA                      	STOSB
 45406                                  
 45407                                  ; Now get original string.
 45408                                  
 45409                                  GetOrig:
 45410 00007995 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45411 00007996 5E                      	pop	si
 45412 00007997 1F                      	pop	ds
 45413                                  
 45414                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45415                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45416                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45418 00007998 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45419 0000799B 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45420 0000799D 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45421 0000799F 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45422                                  ;
 45423                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45424                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45425                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45426                                  ;
 45427 000079A1 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45428                                  SkipPath:
 45429 000079A3 AC                      	LODSB
 45430 000079A4 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45431 000079A7 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45432 000079A9 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45433 000079AA 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45434 000079AC 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45435                                  
 45436                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45437                                  ; for yucks.
 45438                                  
 45439                                  PathAssure:
 45440 000079AE B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45441 000079B0 AA                      	STOSB
 45442                                  
 45443                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45444                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45445                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45446                                  
 45447                                  DoCanon:
 45448 000079B1 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45449                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45450 000079B4 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45451                                  
 45452                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45453                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45454                                  ; buffer.
 45455                                  
 45456 000079B6 16                      	push	ss
 45457 000079B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 45458 000079B8 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45459 000079BC C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45460 000079C0 E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45461 000079C3 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45462                                  
 45463                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45464                                  
 45465 000079C5 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45466 000079C8 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45467 000079CB 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45468                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45469 000079CD 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45470 000079D1 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45471 000079D3 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45472 000079D4 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45473                                  
 45474                                  ; Splice the result.
 45475                                  
 45476                                  DoSplice:
 45477 000079D9 16                      	push	ss
 45478 000079DA 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45479 000079DB 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45480 000079DF 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45481 000079E1 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45482 000079E6 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45483 000079E8 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45484                                  SkipSplice:
 45485                                  
 45486                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45487                                  ; device.
 45488                                  
 45489 000079EB 16                      	push	ss
 45490 000079EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 45491 000079ED C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45492                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45493                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45494                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h

 45509                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45511                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45512                                  ;
 45513                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45514                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45515                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45516                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45517                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45518                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45519                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45520                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45521                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45522                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45524                                  
 45525                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45526                                  
 45527                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45528                                  
 45529                                  Canonicalize:
 45530                                  
 45531                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45532                                  
 45533 00007A06 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45534 00007A07 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP

 45536 00007A0C 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45537 00007A0E 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45538 00007A10 AA                      	STOSB

 45540                                  CanonDec:

 45542                                  
 45543                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45544                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45545                                  ; buffer.
 45546                                  
 45547                                  CanonLoop:
 45548                                  
 45549                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45550                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45551                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45552

 45579                                  ; it to 8.3

 45585                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45586

 45803                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45804                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45805                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45806                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45807                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45808                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45809                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45810                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45811                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45812                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45813                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45814                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45815                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45816                                  ;                   left alone
 45817                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45818                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45819                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45820

 45900                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45901                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45902                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45903                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45904                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45905                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45906                                  ;
 45907                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45908                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45909                                  ;   Outputs:
 45910                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45911                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45912                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45913                                  ;       Carry Set
 45914                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45915                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45917                                  
 45918                                  _$NameTrans:
 45919 00007B97 1E                      	push	ds
 45920 00007B98 56                      	push	si
 45921 00007B99 06                      	push	es

 45923 00007B9B 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45924                                  	
 45925                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45926                                  ; M027 - Start
 45927                                  ;
 45928                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45929                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45930                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45931                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45932                                  ; and restore CX.
 45933                                  
 45934                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45935 00007B9C B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45936 00007B9E E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45937                                  
 45938                                  ; M027 - End
 45939                                  
 45940                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45941 00007BA1 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45942 00007BA4 E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45943 00007BA7 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45944 00007BA8 5F                      	pop     di
 45945 00007BA9 07                      	pop	es

 45947 00007BAB 1F                      	pop     ds

 45949 00007BAE E9D88A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 45950                                  TransOK:

 45952 00007BB4 16                      	push	ss
 45953 00007BB5 1F                      	pop	ds

 45958                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 45959                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45960                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45961                                  ;   pointer.
 45962                                  ;
 45963                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 45964                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number
 45965                                  ;               DS:SI advanced
 45966                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,SI.
 45967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45976 00007BC6 75CE                    	jnz	short Splice_retn
 45977 00007BC8 AD                      	LODSW                           ;           drive = (*s | 020) - 'a'+1;

 45979                                  	;sub	al,60h

 45987                                  ;Break   <TextFromDrive - convert a drive number to a text string>
 45988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45989                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45990                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45991                                  ;
 45992                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 45993                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced
 45994                                  ;   Registers modified: AX
 45995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45999                                  TextFromDrive1:

 46001 00007BD4 0440                    	ADD	AL,'A'-1                ;   *d++ = drive-1+'A';

 46003 00007BD8 AB                      	STOSW
 46004                                  PathPref_retn:
 46005 00007BD9 C3                      	retn
 46006                                  
 46007                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46009                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46010                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46011                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46012                                  ;
 46013                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46014                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46015                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46016                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46017                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46018                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46019                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46020                                  
 46021                                  PathPref:
 46022 00007BDA E8EB9B                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 46023 00007BDD 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46024 00007BDE F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46025 00007BE0 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46026 00007BE2 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46027 00007BE3 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46028 00007BE6 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46029 00007BE9 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46030                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 46031 00007BEB 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 46032 00007BEE E87AFE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 46033                                  Prefix:
 46034 00007BF1 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46035 00007BF2 C3                      	retn
 46036                                  
 46037                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 46038                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46039                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 46040                                  ;     a path separator.
 46041                                  ;
 46042                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46043                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46044                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered
 46045                                  ;     Registers modified: SI
 46046                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46047

 46051 00007BF7 75FA                    	JNZ	short ScanPathChar	; not \, / or NUL => go back for more

 46071                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46072                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46073                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46074                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46075                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46076                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46077                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46078                                  ;
 46079                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46080                                  ;       ------          --------
 46081                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46082                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46083                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46084                                  ;
 46085                                  ;   Error returns:
 46086                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46087                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46088                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46089                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46091                                  
 46092                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46093                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46095                                  ;
 46096                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46097                                  ;
 46098                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46099                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46100                                  ;
 46101                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46102                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46103                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46104                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46105                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46106                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46107                                  ;	USES	all
 46108                                  ;
 46109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46110                                  
 46111                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46112                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46113                                  
 46114                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46115                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h
 46116                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AF10h)
 46117                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)

 46131                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46132                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46133                                  ;
 46134                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46135                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46136                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46137                                  ;

 46139                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 46140                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 46141                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 46142

 46155 00007C1C 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 46156

 46169 00007C2B 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46170 00007C30 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46171                                  
 46172                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46173                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.

 46232                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 46233                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 46234                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 46269                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already

 46359                                  ;
 46360                                  ;	$Creat creates the directory entry specified in DS:DX and gives it the
 46361                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX

 46528                                  ;
 46529                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46530                                  ;
 46531                                  ;
 46532                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46533                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46534                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL

 46536                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46537                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46538                                  ;

 46540                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46541                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46542                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46543                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46544                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46545                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46546                                  ;
 46547                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46548                                  
 46549                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46550                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h

 46555 00007D49 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46556 00007D4C E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path

 46567                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46568                                  	; 17/12/2022

 46714                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46716                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46717                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46718                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46719                                  ;
 46720                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46721                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46722                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46723                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46724                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46725                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46726                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46727                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46728                                  
 46729                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46730 00007DE0 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack

 46732 00007DE4 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46733                                  
 46734                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46735                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46736                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46737                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46738                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46739                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46740                                  ;
 46741                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46742                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46743                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46744                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46746                                  
 46747                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46748                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46749                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46750                                  ;bta5:
 46751                                  ;	push    cx
 46752                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46753                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46754                                  ;	push    ax
 46755                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46756                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46757                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46758                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46759                                  ;	add     al,7
 46760                                  ;bta6: 
 46761                                  ;	stosb
 46762                                  ;	pop     ax
 46763                                  ;	pop     cx
 46764                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46765                                  ;	retn
 46766                                  
 46767                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46768                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46769                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46770                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46771                                  %if 0
 46772                                  
 46773                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46774                                  BinToAscii:
 46775                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46776                                  bta5:	
 46777                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46778                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46779                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46780                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46781                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46782                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46783                                  	dec	ch
 46784                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46785                                  	retn
 46786                                  %else
 46787                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46788                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46789                                  
 46790                                  BinToAscii:
 46791 00007DE7 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46792 00007DE8 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46793                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46794 00007DEA D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46795 00007DEC 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46796 00007DEF AB                      	stosw
 46797 00007DF0 58                      	pop	ax
 46798                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46799 00007DF1 D410                    	aam	10h
 46800 00007DF3 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46801 00007DF6 AB                      	stosw
 46802 00007DF7 C3                      	retn	
 46803                                  %endif

 46805                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46806                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46807                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46808                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46809                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46810                                  ;
 46811                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46812                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46813                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46814                                  ;		AX has handle
 46815                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46816                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46817                                  
 46818                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46819                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46820                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46821                                  
 46822                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46823                                  	;Enter
 46824 00007DF8 55                      	push	bp
 46825 00007DF9 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46826                                  
 46827                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46828                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46829                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46830                                  
 46831 00007DFB 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46832                                  
 46833                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46834 00007DFE F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46835 00007E02 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46836                                  
 46837                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46838                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46839                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46840                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46841                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46842                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46843                                  
 46844                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46845 00007E04 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46846 00007E07 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46847                                  
 46848                                  OKatts:
 46849                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46850 00007E09 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46851                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46852 00007E0C 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46853                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46854 00007E0F 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46855                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46856 00007E12 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46857 00007E15 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46858 00007E16 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46859 00007E17 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46860 00007E19 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46861 00007E1B F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46862                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46863 00007E1D 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46864 00007E1F 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46865                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46866                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46867                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46868 00007E21 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46869                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46870                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46871 00007E22 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46872 00007E24 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46873                                  					;AN000;

 46889                                  CreateLoop:
 46890 00007E36 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46891 00007E37 1F                      	pop	ds
 46892 00007E38 55                      	push	bp
 46893 00007E39 E83F8D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46894 00007E3C 5D                      	pop	bp
 46895                                  ;
 46896                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46897                                  ;
 46898                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46899 00007E3D C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 46900 00007E40 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx

 46902 00007E45 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx

 46912 00007E57 5D                      	pop	bp
 46913 00007E58 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 46914                                  
 46915                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46916                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46917                                  
 46918                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46919                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46920                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46921                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46922                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46923                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46924                                  
 46925                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46926                                  	;cmp	al,50h

 46928 00007E5C 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again

 46931 00007E60 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46932                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46933                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46934                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46935                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46936                                  					;    so.
 46937                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46938                                  %if 0
 46939                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46940                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46941                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46942                                  ;M070
 46943                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46944                                  ;
 46945                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46946                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46947                                  
 46948                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46949                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46950                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46951                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46952                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46953                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46954                                  %else
 46955                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46956                                  	;;;
 46957 00007E62 36A0[2403]              	mov	al,[ss:EXTERR]
 46958 00007E66 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 46959 00007E68 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46960 00007E6A 3C53                    	cmp	al,53h			; error_FAIL_I24
 46961 00007E6C 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR

 46987                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46988                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46989                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46990                                  ;
 46991                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 46992                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
 46993                                  ;   Outputs:	none

 47022                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47023                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47024                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47025                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47026                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47027                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47028                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47029                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47030                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47031                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47032                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47033                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47034                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47035                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47036                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47037                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47038                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47039                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47040                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47042                                  
 47043                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47044                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
