 47264                                  
 47265                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47266                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47267                                  ;
 47268                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47269                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47270                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47271                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47272                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47273                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47274                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47275                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47276                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47277                                  ;
 47278                                  ;   Error returns:
 47279                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47280                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47281                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47282                                  ;
 47283                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47284                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47285                                  ;
 47286                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47287                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47288                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47289                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47290                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47291                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47292                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47293                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47294                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47295                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47296                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47297                                  ;
 47298                                  ;   Error returns:
 47299                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47300                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47301                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47302                                  ;
 47303                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47304                                  
 47305                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47306                                  
 47307                                  	; 17/03/2024
 47308                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47745                                  	;mov	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 47746 0000809C 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx ; 0
 47747                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h]
 47748 000080A0 268B5611                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 47749 000080A4 EB0C                    	jmp     short sharev_2
 47750                                  sharev_1:
 47751                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 47752 000080A6 268B562B                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 47753 000080AA 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 47754                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 47755 000080AE 268B5629                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 47756                                  sharev_2: 
 47757                                  	;;;
 47758 000080B2 E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47759                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47760                                  %if 0
 47761                                  	POP	DI
 47762                                  	POP	ES
 47763                                  	POP	DS
 47764                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47765                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47766                                  	STC
 47767                                  	retn
 47768                                  %else
 47769 000080B5 EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47770                                  %endif
 47771                                  
 47772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47773                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47774                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47775                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47776                                  ;
 47777                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47778                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47779                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47781                                  
 47782                                  ShareEnd:
 47783                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47784 000080B7 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47785 000080BB C3                      	retn
 47786                                  
 47787                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47788                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47789                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47790                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47791                                  ;
 47792                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47793                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47794                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47795                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47796                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47797                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47798                                  
 47799                                  ShareEnter:
 47800 000080BC 51                      	push	cx
 47801                                  retry:
 47802 000080BD 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47803                                  attempt:
 47804 000080C1 C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47805 000080C5 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47806                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47807 000080C7 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47808 000080CB 51                      	push	cx
 47809 000080CC E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47810 000080CF 59                      	pop	cx
 47811 000080D0 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47812 000080D2 E80097                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47813 000080D5 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47814 000080D7 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47815 000080DA 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47816                                  done:
 47817 000080DC 59                      	pop	cx
 47818 000080DD C3                      	retn
 47819                                  
 47820                                  ;============================================================================
 47821                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47822                                  ;============================================================================
 47823                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47824                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47825                                  
 47826                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47827                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47828                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47829                                  ;
 47830                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47831                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47832                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47833                                  ;
 47834                                  ;	Revision history:
 47835                                  ;
 47836                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47838                                  
 47839                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47840                                  ;
 47841                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47842                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47843                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47844                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47845                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47846                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47847                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47848                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47849                                  ;
 47850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47851                                  
 47852                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47853                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47854                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47855                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47856                                  
 47857                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47858                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47859                                  
 47860                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47861                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47862                                  
 47863                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47864                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47865                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47866                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47867                                  
 47868                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47869                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47870                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47871                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47872                                  
 47873                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47874                                  ;
 47875                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47876                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47877                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47878                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47879                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47880                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47881                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47882                                  ; .size:
 47883                                  ;endstruc
 47884                                  
 47885                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47886                                  
 47887                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47888                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47889                                  
 47890                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47891                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47892                                  
 47893                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47894                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47895                                  
 47896                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47897                                  
 47898                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47899                                  ;
 47900                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47901                                  ;
 47902                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47903                                  ;
 47904                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47905                                  
 47906                                  ExecReady:
 47907 000080DE 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47908                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47909                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47910 000080E0 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47911                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47912 000080E4 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47913                                  
 47914                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47915 000080E6 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47916 000080E9 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47917 000080EC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47918                                  
 47919                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47920 000080EE 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47921                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47922 000080F1 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47923                                  
 47924                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47925 000080F4 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47926                                  	
 47927                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47928                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47929 000080F9 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47930                                  
 47931                                  er_setver:
 47932                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47933                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47934 000080FE F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47935                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47936 00008102 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47937                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47938 00008104 1E                      	push	ds
 47939 00008105 56                      	push	si
 47940                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47941 00008106 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47942 00008109 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47943 0000810C E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47944 0000810F 5E                      	pop	si
 47945 00008110 1F                      	pop	ds
 47946                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47947 00008111 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47948 00008114 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47949                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47950 00008118 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47951                                  
 47952                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47953 0000811C 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47954 00008122 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47955                                  
 47956                                  					; M068 - Start
 47957                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47958 00008124 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47959                                  
 47960                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47961 00008127 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47962                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47963                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47964                                  					; explanation
 47965                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47966                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47967 0000812D F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47968                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47969 00008131 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47970                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47971                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47972                                  	;push	ds
 47973                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47974                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47975                                  	;pop	ds
 47976                                  
 47977                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47978 00008133 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47979                                  
 47980                                  er_setA20:
 47981                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47982                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47983                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47984                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47985                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47986                                  
 47987 00008139 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47988 0000813E 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47989                                  					; turned OFF.
 47990                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47991 00008142 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47992 00008144 C3                      	retn
 47993

 48002                                  ;
 48003                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48004                                  ;
 48005                                  	; 15/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 48008                                  ; temp iret instruction
 48009                                  
 48010                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48011                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48012                                  
 48013                                  initiret: ; MSDOS 6.0
 48014                                  SYSBUF:
 48015                                  ;IRETT: ; 06/05/2019
 48016 00008145 CF                      	iret
 48017                                  
 48018                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48019                                  
 48020                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 48021                                  ; initialization code
 48022                                  
 48023 00008146 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 48024                                  
 48025                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48026                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48027                                  
 48028                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48029                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48030                                  
 48031                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48032                                  
 48033                                  ParaRound:
 48034 00008148 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48035 0000814B D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48036 0000814D D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48037 0000814F D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48038 00008151 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48039 00008153 C3                      	retn

 48048                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48049                                  ;
 48050                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48051                                  ;
 48052                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48053                                  ;
 48054                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48055                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48056                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48057                                  ;
 48058                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48059                                  ;
 48060                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48061                                  
 48062                                  WhatCPUType:
 48063                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48064                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48065                                  
 48066                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48067                                  
 48068                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48069                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48070                                  ;
 48071                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48072                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48073                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48074                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48075                                  
 48076                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48077                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48078                                  
 48079                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48080                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48081                                  
 48082                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48083 00008154 9C                      	pushf
 48084 00008155 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48085 00008156 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48086                                  
 48087 00008158 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48088 0000815A 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48089 0000815B 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48090 0000815C 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48091 0000815D 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48092 0000815E 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48093 00008161 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48094 00008164 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48095                                  
 48096 00008166 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48097 00008169 50                      	push	ax
 48098 0000816A 9D                      	popf
 48099 0000816B 9C                      	pushf
 48100 0000816C 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48101 0000816D 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48102 00008170 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48103                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48104 00008172 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48105                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48106 00008173 43                      	inc	bx
 48107                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48108 00008174 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48109 00008176 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48110 00008177 9D                      	popf
 48111                                  	
 48112                                  	;endm
 48113                                  
 48114                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48115 00008178 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48116                                  
 48117                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48118                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 48119

 48122                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48123                                  
 48124                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 48126

 48130

 48132                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48133

 48135                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48136                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48137                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48138                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48139                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48140                                  DOSINIT:
 48141                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48142                                  	;
 48143                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48144                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48145                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48146                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48147                                  	;
 48148                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48149                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48150                                  
 48151 00008179 FA                              CLI
 48152 0000817A FC                              CLD
 48153                                  
 48154                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48155                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48156                                  	
 48157                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48158                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48159                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48160                                  	
 48161 0000817B 56                      	push	si
 48162 0000817C 1E                      	push	ds
 48163 0000817D 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48164                                  
 48165 0000817E 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48166                                  
 48167                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48168                                  
 48169                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48170                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48171                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48172                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48173 00008180 B8[F085]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48174                                  
 48175                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48176 00008183 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48177                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48178                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48179 00008186 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48180                                  
 48181 00008188 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48182                                  					; code segment
 48183                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48184                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48185                                  	;xor	si,si
 48186                                  	
 48187                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48188                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48189                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48190                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48191 0000818A 0E                      	push	cs
 48192 0000818B 1F                      	pop	ds
 48193                                  
 48194                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48195                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48196                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48197                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48198                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48199 0000818C 8E06[4681]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48200                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48201                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48202                                  
 48203                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48204 00008190 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48205                                  
 48206 00008195 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48207                                  
 48208                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48209                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48210                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48211                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48212                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48213                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48214                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata

 49062                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49063                                  ;
 49064                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49065                                  ;
 49066                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49067                                  ;
 49068                                  ;	USED:	none
 49069                                  ;
 49070                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49071                                  
 49072                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49073                                  ;
 49074                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49075                                  ;
 49076 00008477 50                      	push	ax
 49077                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49078 00008478 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49079 0000847B CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49080                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49081                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49082                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49083 0000847D 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49084 0000847F 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49085                                  ;
 49086                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49087                                  ; need to call it later.
 49088                                  ;
 49089 00008481 53                      	push	bx
 49090 00008482 52                      	push	dx
 49091 00008483 1E                      	push	ds
 49092 00008484 06                      	push	es
 49093                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49094 00008485 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49095 00008488 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49096                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49097                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49098                                  
 49099 0000848A 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49100                                  
 49101 0000848F 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49102 00008493 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49103                                  cXMMexit:
 49104 00008497 F8                      	clc
 49105 00008498 07                      	pop	es
 49106 00008499 1F                      	pop	ds
 49107 0000849A 5A                      	pop	dx
 49108 0000849B 5B                      	pop	bx
 49109 0000849C 58                      	pop	ax
 49110 0000849D C3                      	retn				; done
 49111                                  ;
 49112                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49113                                  ;
 49114                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49115 0000849E F9                      	stc
 49116 0000849F 58                      	pop	ax
 49117 000084A0 C3                      	retn

 49119                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49120                                  ;
 49121                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49122                                  ;
 49123                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49124                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49125                                  ;
 49126                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49127                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49128                                  ;		      if first entry
 49129                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49130                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49131                                  ;		      else
 49132                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49133                                  ;
 49134                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49135                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49136                                  ;
 49137                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49138                                  ;
 49139                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx

 49619                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49620                                  ;
 49621                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49622                                  ;
 49623                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49624                                  ;
 49625                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49626                                  ;
 49627                                  ;	Description:
 49628                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49629                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49630                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49631                                  ;
 49632                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49633                                  
 49634                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49635                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h

 49786                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 49787                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 49788                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 49789                                  ;

 49791                                  ; describing that data item.

 49886                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 49887                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49888                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49889                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49890                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49891                                  ;;
 49892                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49893                                  ;;
 49894                                  ;;	on return:
 49895                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49896                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49897                                  ;;
 49898                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49899                                  ;;
 49900                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49901                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49902                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49903                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49904                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49905                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49906                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49907                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49908                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49909                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49910                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49911                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49912                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49913                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49914                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49915                                  ;;
 49916                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49917

 50124                                  ;============================================================================
 50125                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50126                                  ;============================================================================
 50127                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50128                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50129                                  
 50130                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50132                                  
 50133                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50134                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50135                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50136                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50137                                  ;
 50138                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50139                                  ; describing that data item.
 50140                                  
 50141                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50142                                  
 50143                                  ;
 50144                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50145                                  ;
 50146                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50147                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50148                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50149                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50150                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50151                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50152                                  ;
 50153                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50154                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50155                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50156                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50157                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50158                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50159                                  ;   as EOF).
 50160                                  
 50161                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50162                                  
 50163                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50164                                  
 50165                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50166 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50167 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50168                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50169 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50170                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50171 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50172                                  
 50173                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50174                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50175                                  ; console.
 50176                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50177 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50178 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50179                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50180 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50181 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50182                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50183 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50184 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50185 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50186                                  switch_character:
 50187 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50188 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50189 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50190 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50191 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50192                                  
 50193                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 50194                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 50195                                  
 50196                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50197                                  
 50198                                  ;PUBLIC	CritPatch
 50199                                  
 50200                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 50201                                  
 50202                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>
 50203

 50205                                  ;

 50207                                  ;
 50208                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 50209                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 50210                                  ;
 50211                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  E&sect
 50212                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  L&sect
 50213                                  ;
 50214                                  ;ELSE
 50215                                  ;	DW	0
 50216                                  ;	DW	0
 50217                                  ;ENDIF
 50218                                  ;ENDM

 50255

 50270                                  				;   extended error type stuff.

 50273                                  				;   GetExtendedError system calls)
 50274 0000033C 0000                    PROC_ID:	dw 0		; PID for sharing (0 = local)
 50275 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)
 50276 00000340 0000                    FirstArena:	dw 0		; first free block found
 50277 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found
 50278 00000344 0000                    LastArena:	dw 0		; last free block found
 50279 00000346 0000                    ENDMEM:		dw 0		; End of memory used in DOSINIT
 50280 00000348 0000                    LASTENT:	dw 0		; Last entry for directory search
 50281 0000034A 00                      FAILERR:	db 0		; NZ if user did FAIL on I 24
 50282 0000034B 00                      ALLOWED:	db 0		; Allowed I 24 answers (see allowed_)
 50283 0000034C 00                      NoSetDir:	db 0		; true -> do not set directory
 50284 0000034D 00                      DidCTRLC:	db 0		; true -> we did a ^C exit
 50285 0000034E 00                      SpaceFlag:	db 0		; true -> embedded spaces are allowed in FC

 50401                                  ;============================================================================
 50402                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50403                                  ;============================================================================
 50404                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50405                                  
 50406                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50407                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50408                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50409                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50410                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50411                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50412                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50413                                  ; **********************************************************
 50414                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50415                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50416                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50417                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50418                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50419                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50420                                  
 50421                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50423                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50424                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50425                                  
 50426                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50427                                  
 50428                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50429                                  
 50430                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50431                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50432 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50433 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50434                                  
 50435                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50436                                  
 50437                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50438                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50439 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50440                                  RENBUF:	
 50441 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50442                                  
 50443                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50444                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50445 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50446                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50447 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50448                                  
 50449                                  ; End of contiguous buffer

 50452                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50457                                  
 50458                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50459                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50460                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50461

 50469                                  	;times	5  db	0

 50471                                  
 50472                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50473

 51019                                  
 51020                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51021                                  ;
 51022                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51023                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51024                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51025                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51026                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51028                                  ; Example:
 51029                                  
 51030                                  MAP_CASE:
 51031                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51032                                  
 51033 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51034                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51035                                  	;RETF
 51036                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51037                                  	;;;
 51038 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51039                                  	;;;
 51040                                  Map1:
 51041 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51042 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51043 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51044 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51045                                  FINISH:
 51046 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51047 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51048 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51049 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51050 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51051                                  L_RET:	
 51052 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51053                                  
 51054                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51055

 51402                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51403                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51404                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51405                                  
 51406                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51407                                  ;
 51408                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51409                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51410                                  ;
 51411                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51412                                  ;
 51413                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51414                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51415                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51416                                  ;
 51417                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51418                                  
 51419                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51420                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51421                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51422                                  ;ELSE
 51423                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51424                                  ;ENDIF
 51425                                  ;ENDM
 51426

 51844                                  
 51845                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51846                                  ;
 51847                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51848                                  ;
 51849                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51850                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51851                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51852                                  ;
 51853                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51854                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51855                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51856                                  ;	   4. else 
 51857                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51858                                  ;	   6. endif
 51859                                  ;	7. else
 51860                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51861                                  ;	9. endif
 51862                                  ;
 51863                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51864                                  
 51865                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51866                                  
 51867                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51868                                  
 51869                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51870                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51871                                  
 51872                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51873                                  ;
 51874                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51875                                  ;
 51876                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51877                                  
 51878                                  ldivov:
 51879                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51880                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51881                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51882                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51883                                  i0patch:
 51884 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51885                                  
 51886 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51887                                  divov_cont:
 51888 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51889                                  
 51890                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51891                                  ;
 51892                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51893                                  ;
 51894                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51895                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51896                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51897                                  ; will be restored then.
 51898                                  ;
 51899                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51900                                  
 51901                                  lquit:
 51902                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51903                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51904                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51905                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51906                                  i20patch:
 51907 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51908                                  
 51909 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51910                                  quit_cont:
 51911 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51912                                  
 51913                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51914                                  ;
 51915                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51916                                  ;
 51917                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51918                                  
 51919                                  lcommand:
 51920                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51921                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51922                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51923                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51924                                  i21patch:
 51925 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51926                                  
 51927 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51928                                  command_cont:
 51929 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51930                                  
 51931                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51932                                  ;
 51933                                  ; INT 25h
 51934                                  ;
 51935                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51936                                  
 51937                                  labsdrd:
 51938                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51939                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51940                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51941                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51942                                  i25patch:
 51943 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51944                                  
 51945 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51946                                  absdrd_cont:
 51947 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51948                                  
 51949                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51950                                  ;
 51951                                  ; INT 26h
 51952                                  ;
 51953                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51954                                  
 51955                                  labsdwrt:
 51956                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51957                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51958                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51959                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51960                                  i26patch:
 51961 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51962                                  
 51963 00000F9A E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51964                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51965 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51966                                  
 51967                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51968                                  ;
 51969                                  ; INT 27h
 51970                                  ;
 51971                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51972                                  
 51973                                  lstay_resident:
 51974                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51975                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51976                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51977                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51978                                  i27patch:
 51979 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 51980                                  
 51981 00000FA4 E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51982                                  sr_cont:
 51983 00000FA7 2EFF2E[600F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 51984

 51986                                  ;
 51987                                  ; INT 2Fh
 51988                                  ;
 51989                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51990

 51993                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51994                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51995                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51996                                  i2fpatch:
 51997 00000FAC EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 51998

 52002

 52011                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 52012                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver

 52020
