 52025                                  %if 0
 52026                                  
 52027                                  lirett:
 52028                                  	iret
 52029                                  
 52030                                  %endif
 52031                                  
 52032                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52033                                  ;
 52034                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52035                                  ;
 52036                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52037                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52038                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52039                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52040                                  ;
 52041                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52042                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52043                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52044                                  ;
 52045                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52046                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52047                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52048                                  ;
 52049                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52050                                  
 52051                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52052                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52053                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52054                                  
 52055 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52056 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52057                                  
 52058                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52059                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52060                                  %if 0
 52061                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52062                                  %endif
 52063                                  
 52064                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52065                                  LowInt23:
 52066                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52067                                  					; the stack
 52068 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52069 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52070                                  
 52071 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52072                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52073                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52074                                  
 52075 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52076                                  
 52077 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52078                                  
 52079                                  
 52080                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52081                                  LowInt24:
 52082                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52083                                  					; the stack
 52084 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52085 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52086                                  
 52087 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52088                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52089                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52090                                  
 52091 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52092                                  
 52093 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52094                                  
 52095                                  
 52096                                   
 52097                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52098                                  LowInt28:
 52099 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52100                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52101                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52102                                  
 52103 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52104                                  
 52105 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52106                                  
 52107                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52108                                  
 52109                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52110                                  ;
 52111                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52112                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52113                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52114                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52115                                  ;
 52116                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52117                                  
 52118                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52119                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52120                                  
 52121                                  disa20_xfer:
 52122 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52123                                  
 52124                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52125                                  
 52126                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52127                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52128                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52129                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52130                                  
 52131 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52132 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52133                                  
 52134                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52135                                  	;;;
 52136 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52137                                  	;;;
 52138                                  
 52139 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52140 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52141 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52142                                  
 52143 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52144 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52145 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52146 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52147 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52148 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52149                                  
 52150                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52151                                  ;
 52152                                  ; M003:
 52153                                  ;
 52154                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52155                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52156                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52157                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52158                                  ; more info.
 52159                                  ;
 52160                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52161                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52162                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52163                                  ;
 52164                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52165                                  
 52166                                  disa20_iret:
 52167 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52168 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52169                                  
 52170                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52171                                  	;;;
 52172 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52173                                  	;;;
 52174                                  
 52175 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52176 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52177 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52178                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52179 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52180                                  	
 52181                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52182                                  %if 0
 52183                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52184                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52185                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52186                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52187                                  %else
 52188                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52189                                  	;;;
 52190                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52191 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52192 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52193 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52194                                  	;;;
 52195                                  %endif
 52196 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52197 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52198 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52199 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52200 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52201 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52202 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52203 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52204 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52205                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52206 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52207                                  
 52208                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52209                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52210                                  ;
 52211                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52212                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52213                                  ;
 52214                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52215                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52216                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52217                                  ;
 52218                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52219                                  
 52220                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52221 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52222 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52223                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52224 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52225 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52226 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52227 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52228 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52229                                  
 52230                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52231                                  
 52232                                  XMMcontrol:
 52233 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52234                                  
 52235                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52236                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52237                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52238                                  ;;;
 52239 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52240                                  SC_STATUS:
 52241 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52242                                  ;;;
 52243                                  
 52244                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52245                                  ;
 52246                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52247                                  ;
 52248                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52249                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52250                                  ;
 52251                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52252                                  ;
 52253                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52254                                  ;		
 52255                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52256                                  ;
 52257                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52258                                  
 52259                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52260                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52261                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52262                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52263                                  ;
 52264                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52265                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52266                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52267                                  
 52268                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52269                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52270                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52271                                  
 52272                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52273 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52274 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52275 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52276 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52277 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52278 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52279                                  
 52280                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52281                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52282                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52283                                  
 52284                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52285                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52286                                  	;;;
 52287 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52288 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52289 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52290 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52291 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52292 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52293                                  	;;;	
 52294                                  
 52295 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52296 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52297 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52298                                  
 52299 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52300                                  EA20_RET:
 52301 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52302 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52303 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52304 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52305 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52306 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52307 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52308                                  
 52309                                  EA20_OFF:
 52310                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52311                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52312                                  
 52313 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52314 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52315                                  
 52316                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52317                                  %if 0
 52318                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52319                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52320                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52321                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52322                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52323                                  %else
 52324                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52325                                  	;;;
 52326 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52327 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52328 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52329 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52330                                  	;;;
 52331                                  %endif
 52332 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52333                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52334                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52335 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52336 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52337 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52338 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52339                                  
 52340                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52341                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52342                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52343                                  	;;;
 52344 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52345                                  	;;;
 52346 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52347                                  
 52348 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52349 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52350                                  
 52351 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52352                                  
 52353                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52354 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52355 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52356 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52357 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52358                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52359                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52360                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52361                                  	;;;
 52362 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52363                                  	;;;
 52364 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52365                                  XMMcont:
 52366                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52367                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52368                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52369                                  	;;;
 52370 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52371                                  	;;;
 52372 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52373                                  	
 52374 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52375 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52376 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52377 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52378                                  XMMprnt:
 52379 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52380 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52381 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52382 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52383 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52384 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52385 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52386                                  
 52387                                  XMMStall:
 52388 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52389 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52390

 52569                                  
 52570                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52571                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52572                                  ;
 52573                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52574                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52575                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52576                                  ;
 52577                                  ;
 52578                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52579                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52580                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52581                                  
 52582                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52583                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52584                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52585                                  
 52586                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52587                                  
 52588                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52589                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52590                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52591                                  
 52592                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52593                                  
 52594                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52595                                  ;
 52596                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52597                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52598                                  ;
 52599                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52600                                  ;	push	es
 52601                                  ;	push	di
 52602                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52603                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52604                                  ;	pop	di
 52605                                  ;	pop	es
 52606                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52607                                  
 52608                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52609                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52610                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52611                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52612                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52613                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52614                                  	
 52615                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52616                                  
 52617                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52618                                  ;
 52619                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52620                                  ;
 52621                                  ;		push	cx
 52622                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52623                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52624                                  ;		jz	????
 52625                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52626                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52627                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52628                                  
 52629                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52630                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52631                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52632                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52633                                  
 52634                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52635                                  
 52636                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52637                                  ;
 52638                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52639                                  ;
 52640                                  ;
 52641                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52642                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52643                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52644                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52645                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52646                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52647                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52648                                  
 52649                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52650                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52651                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52652                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52653                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52654                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52655                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52656                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52657                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52658                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52659                                  
 52660                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52661                                  
 52662                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52663                                  ;
 52664                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52665                                  ;
 52666                                  ;
 52667                                  ;
 52668                                  ;	push	ax
 52669                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52670                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52671                                  ;	pop	ax
 52672                                  ;	jz	????
 52673                                  
 52674                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52675                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52676                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52677                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52678                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52679                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52680                                  
 52681                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52682                                  
 52683                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52684                                  ;
 52685                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52686                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52687                                  ;
 52688                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52689                                  ;
 52690                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52691                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52692                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52693                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52694                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52695                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52696                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52697                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52698                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52699                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52700                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52701                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52702                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52703                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52704                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52705                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52706                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52707                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52708                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52709                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52710                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52711                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52712                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52713                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52714                                  ;
 52715                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52716                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52717                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52718                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52719                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52720                                  ;
 52721                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52722                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52723                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52724                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52725                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52726                                  
 52727                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52728                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52729                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52730                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52731                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52732                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52733                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52734                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52735                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52736                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52737                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52738                                  			db	009H,003H
 52739                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52740                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52741                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52742                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52743                                  			db	05FH
 52744                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52745                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52746                                  
 52747                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52748                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52749                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52750                                  
 52751                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52752                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52753                                  ;
 52754                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52755                                  ;
 52756                                  ;
 52757                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52758                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52759                                  ;	    je l1
 52760                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52761                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52762                                  ;	    int 10h
 52763                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52764                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52765                                  
 52766                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52767                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52768                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52769                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52770                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52771                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52772                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52773                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52774                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 52831                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52832                                  ;
 52833                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52834                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52835                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52836                                  ;

 52847                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52848                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52849                                  
 52850                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52851                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52852                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52853                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52854                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52855                                  
 52856                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52857                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52858                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52859                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52860                                  
 52861                                  ; country and code page information
 52862                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52863                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52864 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52865 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52865 00001143 53595300           
 52866                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52867 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52868                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52869                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52870                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52871                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52872                                  ;  endif
 52873                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52874                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52875                                  ;  endif
 52876                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52877                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52878                                  ;  endif
 52879                                  ;else
 52880 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52881                                  ;endif
 52882                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52883 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52884                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52885 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52886 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52887 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52888 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52889 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52890 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52891 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52892 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52893 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52894 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52895 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52896 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter

 52898 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK

 52988 00001240 79                      	db 'y'
 52989                                  NLS_no2:
 52990 00001241 6E                      	db 'n'
 52991                                  
 52992                                  unknown_zero_dd:
 52993 00001242 00000000                	dd 0

 53013                                  
 53014                                  ;============================================================================
 53015                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53016                                  ;============================================================================
 53017                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53018                                  
 53019                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53020                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53021                                  ;
 53022                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53023                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53024                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53025                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53026                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53027                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53028                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53029                                  ; to call out here.
 53030                                  ;
 53031                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53032                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53033                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53034                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53035                                  ;
 53036                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53037                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53038                                  ;
 53039                                  ;Exported Functions
 53040                                  ;==================
 53041                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53042                                  
 53043                                  ; DosData Segment
 53044                                  
 53045                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53046                                  
 53047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53048                                  
 53049                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53050                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53051                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53052                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53053                                  
 53054                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53055 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53056                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53057                                  
 53058                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53059                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53060                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53061                                  
 53062                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53063                                  %if 0
 53064                                  MagicPatch:
 53065                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53066                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53067                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53068                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53069                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53070                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53071                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53072                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53073                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53074                                  %endif
 53075                                  
 53076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53077                                  
 53078                                  ;DosData Ends
 53079                                  
 53080                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53081                                  ;
 53082                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53083                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53084                                  
 53085                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53086                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53087                                  
 53088                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 53089

 53091

 53111                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 53112                                  
 53113                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53114                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53115                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53116                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53117                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53118                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 53119                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
